meanings.definition: Persuaded or enticed someone to do something through deception or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She inveigled her friend into sharing her toys by complimenting her.
meanings.sent2: The salesman inveigled the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox inveigled the rabbit out of its burrow with sweet words.
meanings.sent4: The sly cat inveigled the bird from its nest with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The magician inveigled the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.

meanings.definition: Obtained something by coaxing or trickery.
meanings.sent1: He inveigled his way into getting a discount on the car.
meanings.sent2: The thief inveigled the jewels from the safe using a clever plan.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child inveigled extra cookies from the jar by pretending to be sad.
meanings.sent4: The con artist inveigled money from unsuspecting victims with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent5: The cunning spy inveigled valuable information from the enemy agent.
